Class DiseaseTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • DiseaseTree

  • public class DiseaseTree
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance of DiseaseTree represents the spreading of a Disease among a Network of people. In this model, each person can "catch" the disease from only a single person. The root of the DiseaseTree is the person who first got the disease. From there, each person in the DiseaseTree is the child of the person who gave them the disease. For example, for the tree: A / \ B C / \ D E Person A originally got the disease, B and C caught the disease from A, and D and E caught the disease from C. Important note: The name of each person in the disease tree is unique.
    Author:
    Mshnik

    • Constructor Detail

      • DiseaseTree

        public DiseaseTree(Person p)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor: a new DiseaseTree with root p and no children. Throw an IllegalArgumentException if p is null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • DiseaseTree

        public DiseaseTree(DiseaseTree p)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor: a new DiseaseTree that is a copy of tree p. Tree p and its copy have no node in common (but nodes can share a Person). Throw an IllegalArgumentException if p is null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • Method Detail

      • getRoot

        public Person getRoot()
        Return the person that is at the root of this DiseaseTree

      • getChildrenCount

        public int getChildrenCount()
        Return the number of DiseaseTrees that are direct children of this DiseaseTree

      • getChildren

        public java.util.Set<DiseaseTree> getChildren()
        Return a COPY of the set of children of this DiseaseTree.

      • add

        public DiseaseTree add(Person p,
                       Person c)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add c to this DiseaseTree as a child of p and return the DiseaseTree whose root is the new child. Throw an IllegalArgumentException if:
        -- p or c is null,
        -- c is already in this DiseaseTree, or
        -- p is not in this DiseaseTree
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • size

        public int size()
        Return the number of people contained in this DiseaseTree. Note: If this is a leaf, the size is 1 (just the root)

      • depthOf

        public int depthOf(Person p)
        Return the depth at which p occurs in this DiseaseTree, or -1 if p is not in the DiseaseTree. Note: depthOf(root) is 0. If p is a child of this DiseaseTree, then depthOf(p) is 1. etc.

      • getTree

        public DiseaseTree getTree(Person p)
        If p is in this tree, return the DiseaseTree object in this tree that contains p. If p is not in this tree, return null. Example: Calling getTree(root) should return this.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Person p)
        Return true iff this DiseaseTree contains p.

      • maxDepth

        public int maxDepth()
        Return the maximum depth of this DiseaseTree, i.e. the longest path from the root to a leaf. Example. If this DiseaseTree is a leaf, return 0.

      • widthAtDepth

        public int widthAtDepth(int d)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return the width of this tree at depth d (i.e. the number of diseaseTrees that occur at depth d, where the depth of the root is 0. Throw an IllegalArgumentException if depth < 0. Thus, for the following tree : Depth level: 0 A / \ 1 B C / / \ 2 D E F \ 3 G A.widthAtDepth(0) = 1, A.widthAtDepth(1) = 2, A.widthAtDepth(2) = 3, A.widthAtDepth(3) = 1, A.widthAtDepth(4) = 0. C.widthAtDpth(0) = 1, C.widthAtDepth(1) = 2
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • maxWidth

        public int maxWidth()
        Return the maximum width of all the widths in this tree, i.e. the maximum value that could be returned from widthAtDepth for this tree.

      • getDiseaseRouteTo

        public java.util.List<Person> getDiseaseRouteTo(Person c)
        Return the route the disease took to get from "here" (the root of this DiseaseTree) to child c. For example, for this tree: Depth level: 0 A / \ 1 B C / / \ 2 D E F \ 3 G A.getDiseaseRouteTo(E) should return a list of [A,C,E]. A.getDiseaseRouteTo(A) should return [A]. A.getDiseaseRouteTo(X) should return null. B.getDiseaseRouteTo(C) should return null. B.getDiseaseRouteTo(D) should return [B,D]

      • getParentOf

        public Person getParentOf(Person c)
        Return the immediate parent of c (null if c is not in this DiseaseTree). Thus, for the following tree: Depth level: 0 A / \ 1 B C / / \ 2 D E F \ 3 G A.getParentOf(E) returns C. C.getParentOf(E) returns C. A.getParentOf(B) returns A. E.getParentOf(F) returns null.

      • getSharedAncestorOf

        public Person getSharedAncestorOf(Person child1,
                                  Person child2)
        If child1 is null or child2 is null, return null. Otherwise, Return the most direct shared ancestor of child1 and child2 in this DiseaseTree. If the true ancestor of the two people is not in this subtree, return null instead. If either child is the true root (A, below), return null. Thus, for the following tree: Depth level: 0 A / \ 1 B C / / \ 2 D E F \ 3 G A.getSharedAncestorOf(B,C) is A A.getSharedAncestorOf(A,C) is null A.getSharedAncestorOf(E,F) is C A.getSharedAncestorOf(G,F) is C A.getSharedAncestorOf(null,C) is null B.getSharedAncestorOf(D,F) is null C.getSharedAncestorOf(C,C) is null

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return a (single line) String representation of this DiseaseTree. If this DiseaseTree has no children (it is a leaf), return the root's substring. Otherwise, return root's substring + SEPARATOR + START_CHILDREN_DELIMITER + each child's toString, separated by DELIMITER, followed by END_CHILD_DELIMITER. Make sure there is not an extra DELIMITER following the last child. Finally, make sure to use the static final fields declared at the top of DiseaseTree.java. Thus, for the following tree: Depth level: 0 A / \ 1 B C / / \ 2 D E F \ 3 G A.toString() should print: (A) - HEALTHY - [(C) - HEALTHY - [(F) - HEALTHY, (E) - HEALTHY - [(G) - HEALTHY]], (B) - HEALTHY - [(D) - HEALTHY]] C.toString() should print: (C) - HEALTHY - [(F) - HEALTHY, (E) - HEALTHY - [(G) - HEALTHY]]
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • toStringVerbose

        public java.lang.String toStringVerbose()
        Return a verbose (multi-line) string representing this DiseaseTree.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object ob)
        Return true iff this is equal to ob. Two DiseaseTrees are equal if they are the same object (==) or:
        - they have the same root Person object (==)
        - their children sets are equal, which requires:
        --- the two sets are of the same size
        --- for every DiseaseTree dt in one set, there is a DiseaseTree dt2 in the other set for which dt.equals(dt2) is true. Otherwise the two DiseaseTrees are not equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • equalsAChild

        public static boolean equalsAChild(DiseaseTree t,
                                   java.util.Set<DiseaseTree> trees)
        Return true iff c equals some tree in trees.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Optional: You may implement this method if you want to. Doing so (correctly) allows for a very simple implementation of equals. This method will not be tested in any way. For rules on how to implement a hashCode() method correctly, see Object.hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Create a population of 7 people with health 10, create a disease tree with certain edges, and then print the resulting tree on the console.
